citation.article-title: Amycolatopsis alba sp. nov., isolated from soil.

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis alba sp. nov.
Amycolatopsis alba (A.my.co.la.top'sis. M.L. fem. n.; al'ba. L. fem. adj. alba, white, referring to the white aerial hyphae)
Cells are aerobic, nonmotile, not acid fast, gram positive, filamentous, and differentiated into substrate and aerial hyphae with a diameter of 1.0 μm.
The vegetative hyphae have a tendency to fragment when the organism is grown in liquid culture.
The aerial hyphae are white, and the vegetative mycelium is yellowish brown.
A faint soluble pigment is produced on some media.
Cylindrical, smooth spores are formed with a typical cobweb morphology.
Acid is produced from the following carbohydrates: D-arabinose, D-fructose, D-glucose, glycerol, D-mannose, D-ribose, and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from cellulose, dulcitol, ethanol, glycogen, inulin, melezitose, D-sorbitol, L-sorbose, and xylitol.
The following carbohydrates are utilized when ISP medium 9 is the basal medium: D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, inositol, D-mannitol, raffinose, salicin, and D-xylose.
L-Arabinose, L-rhamnose, and sucrose are not utilized.
Assimilates acetate, butyrate, formate, lactate, malate, propionate, pyruvate, and succinate, but not oxalate, mucate, and tartrate.
Strain A83850T utilizes allantoin, calcium malate, casein, elastin, hippurate, and L-tyrosine, but is not able to degrade adenine and guanine.
Skim milk is hydrolyzed but not peptonized.
Testosterone is very weakly hydrolyzed.
Catalase, esculinase, gelatinase, and H,S are produced.
Strain A83850T does not produce melanoid pigments and is not able to survive at 50°C for 8 h.
A83850T grows at temperatures between 15 and 37°C.
Strain A83850T conzhytains meso-diaminopimelic acid and has a type A whole-cell sugar pattern and a type PII phospholipid pattern.
Mycolic acids are not present.
The major menaquinone detected is MK-9(H4); there is also a minor amount of MK-8(H4).
Strain A83850T differs from the other Amycolatopsis species in fatty acid composition (Table 4) and in morphological, cultural, and physiological characteristics (Table 2).
Type strain.
The type strain is A83850 (= NRRL 18532).
This strain was isolated from soil.
The species description is based on a single strain and thus serves as the type strain description.
